title: Will a candidate included on the "List of Hope" or the "People's Expert's List" be elected as the next chairman of Iran's Assembly of Experts?
preds: It looks like GJO need a few more hamsters powering the web site.

Amini announces his intention to run on Monday and the vote is on Tuesday?    That's peculiar and makes me wonder:  
Was he intentionally trying to split the progressive vote?  
Did they rush the vote to limit his ability to organize and campaign?  
And why after winning just last month would they (the moderates and progressives) vote for someone other than a progressive moderate? Iran is a weird place, second only to North Korea. http://www.tehrantimes.com/news/402756/Ayatollah-Amini-to-run-for-Assembly-of-Experts-chair
Ahmad Jannati Massah is a hardline Iranian politician, Shi'i cleric and a founding member of Haghani school. Just elected.
I was so wrong that I was a little bit right in the end

http://en.mehrnews.com/news/116806/Jannati-next-chair-of-Iran-s-Assembly-of-Experts
"At the opening session of the 5th Assembly of Experts held on Tuesday morning in Tehran, Ayatollah Ahmad Jannati was elected as the chairman of the 5th Assembly of Experts on Tuesday." https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Iranian_Assembly_of_Experts_election,_2016
- not on PE or FoM lists.
Since Amini is in the running, I assume that he will get it: http://www.tehrantimes.com/news/402756/Ayatollah-Amini-to-run-for-Assembly-of-Experts-chair
ah well, it's gonna be Amini after all (I think): http://www.tehrantimes.com/news/402756/Ayatollah-Amini-to-run-for-Assembly-of-Experts-chair

AFAIK Sharoudi is on the list of the 'Society of Seminary Teachers of Qom' (1), a list that in the past was allied with the 'Combatant Clergy Association'  Rouhani went to Qom yesterday (2) (3) and met with several members of the 'Society of Seminary Teachers of Qom' (Grand Ayatollah Lotfollah Safi Golpayegani, Grand Ayatollah Nasser Makarem Shirazi and Ayatollah Hossein Vahid Khorasani). You can find their names here (4), they appear in the table from Razavi Khorasan province. Sharoudi has been mentioned in the past as a possible successor of Khamenei (5) (1) https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Society_of_Seminary_Teachers_of_Qom
(2) http://www7.irna.ir/en/News/82081833/
(3) http://www.iran-daily.com/News/151733.html
(4) https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Iranian_Assembly_of_Experts_election,_2016#Provinces_with_4_seats_and_less
(5) http://www.israelnationalnews.com/News/News.aspx/192197#.Vz_qvpOGOu4

http://www.irantracker.org/iran-news-round-may-19-2016 "Combatant Clergy Association member Hojjat ol Eslam Hossein Ebrahimi claimed that the race for the Assembly of Experts chairmanship will therefore be between Interim Tehran Friday Prayer Leader Ayatollah Mohammad Ali Movahedi Kermani and Guardian Council member Ayatollah Mahmoud Hashemi Shahroudi.
~~~~~~~
COMMENT:  It appears that I've found the same story as Rene, but unlike @Rene, I was unable to either name on either list, so I'm so glad he could!  http://www.gjopen.com/comments/comments/239135 However, in his edit, I think Rene may have confused news about the Majles with that of the Assembly of Experts, as there's only 88 seats in the Assembly of Experts. ~~~~~~~
POST MORTEM:  A hardliner won. OUCH!!!  I was at 95%!   What was I thinking?   I put way too much stock in the rumors about who was being considered and didn't pay enough attention to how weak the reformists actually are.  A forecast much closer to 50% was probably all that was justified given how little I knew and the facts of the situation.   I allowed myself to get caught up in a race to 0 or 100.  Live and learn.

Goodby leaderboard!  Sigh.

"Expediency Discernment Council Chairman Ayatollah Akbar Hashemi Rafsanjani claimed that he is not “currently” planning on running in the internal election on May 24 to chair the Assembly of Experts. Rafsanjani had previously chaired the Assembly of Experts, and it is widely speculated that he will run in the upcoming election. Combatant Clergy Association member Hojjat ol Eslam Hossein Ebrahimi claimed that the race for the Assembly of Experts chairmanship will therefore be between Interim Tehran Friday Prayer Leader Ayatollah Mohammad Ali Movahedi Kermani and Guardian Council member Ayatollah Mahmoud Hashemi Shahroudi. The current Assembly of Experts chairman, Ayatollah Mohammad Yazdi, was not re-elected to the Assembly." Source: http://www.criticalthreats.org/iran-news-round-may-19-2016 NOTE: Kermani is on the 'People's Experts List'. However, I cannot find the name of Shahroudi on either list
See: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pervasive_Coalition_of_Reformists and https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/People%27s_Experts -------- Edit: Also, from the first source, a bad sign perhaps for the reformers: " Although candidates who ran under the List of Hope won a plurality of seats in the elections, it is still unclear how many lawmakers will join the faction. During the Hope faction’s first meeting, only 105 parliamentarians were present, far below the estimates that between 120 and 160 parliamentarians would join the faction. Aref dismissed concerns that this figure was somehow indicative of the faction’s weakness, stating, “One should not judge the strength of this faction on the first day.” Meanwhile, a reported 131 parliamentarians attended the first meeting of the rival principlist coalition."

I though I was optomisitic with 89% , but I am willing to get closer to the consensus .
its a bet that depends on  the Iranian leader.
What we know is that in the majlis , the presidents men are in the majority , but I think the chances are that the head of majlis continues to be an ex conservative 
Playing  both sides . 
Some conservatives are now in alliance with the so called  moderates . I believe if head of majlis switches to the moderates 
Then communications with leadership would not be fluid .  mr. Larijani  is close to leadership and close to moderates with years of experience , he may actually keep his job for that reason.
There are people that believe in order to make changes in Iranian politics , moderates may let larijani keep his post 
In order to strengthen the bond and maybe in exchange for  their  help to elect a person from those lists for head of assembly of experts!
I predict Irans head of majlis will  remain larijani , but a more moderate person as head of experts. 
You cannot get a worse head of assembly of experts as the current one. 
He is an old angry extreme right mullah  &  half of the time he talks complete none sense and the other half people cannot understand what he is saying! 
Head of assembly of experts is very important for change in the So called Islamic republic. 
As their ex head of majlis currently in jail mr. Karubi said : 
Currently Iran is neither a republic nor not really ... Islamic !
Irans consumption of alcohol per capita  is higher than all its neighbors combined, consumption of drugs & prostitution  are rampant 
In the society ,  etc... 
As far as republic it's yet to be proven.  Iran has only had 2 supreme leaders for the past 37 years since 1979 revolution .

anyone have the ability to run optical character recognition (OCR) or something similar in farsi? i'd like to get searchable text (that's not nonsense) for three PDF documents at the following link. 
http://irandataportal.syr.edu/the-assembly-of-experts
Suggestions that don't involve buying things would also be appreciated.
Also if anyone's seen similar bios for this election cycle, that'd be of interest. Presumably they don't get published till later.
Moving up from 90% on 20 April, to match consensus

Amini, 91, is a former Qom Friday prayer leader and is highly respected among all factions. That he appeared on both the Principlists’ and Rafsanjani’s ticket for the February elections serves as an indicator of his stature.  http://www.al-monitor.com/pulse/originals/2016/03/iran-assembly-of-experts-internal-election-chairmanship.html#ixzz48WsZMBdD Is Amini a ' People's Expert' List Candidate then? Yes, right?
Iran’s Assembly of Experts to Pick New Chairman This Month: http://www.tasnimnews.com/en/news/2016/05/12/1073313/iran-s-assembly-of-experts-to-pick-new-chairman-this-month

The moderates + independents form a majority in the parliament. Either Rafsanjani or Amini (who appeared on Principlists and Rafsanjanis list so technically he is on Peoples Experts List) will take the majority
Because Consensus has strongly increased, the recent news suggests the List of Hope has won more seats.

Upping my forecast since elections went so well.  Iran is coming out of its darkness and becoming a normal country again.  Watch and see.  Women have more rights in Iran than in a lot of other, especially Muslim, countries.  That makes a difference over time.

Mostafa Kavakebian,  Kazem Jalali, and Ali Larijani.  Laranjani is a Principlist who ran as an independent candidate in the elections.  Both Kavakebian and Jalali (an incumbent in the Islamic Consultative Assembly, and member of the Iranian parliament since 2006) are in the (List of Hope) faction.  It is likely that a List of Hope candidate will become Chairman of the Assembly of experts (Parliament) given the plurality obtained in the 2016 election.   This outcome will be dependent on the Independent Parliamentary members (given the small variance between it and the Principlists).
It appears that a decision was already made by the Assembly of Experts for Chairman by its members but has had limited publication.

Amini, 91, is a former Qom Friday prayer leader and is highly respected among all factions. That he appeared on both the Principlists’ and Rafsanjani’s ticket for the February elections serves as an indicator of his stature. Amini has moderate views and is close to Rafsanjani. Indeed, after the 2013 presidential elections, Rafsanjani offered him the leadership of the Expediency Council’s Center for Strategic Research, which Hassan Rouhani headed until assuming the presidency that year.
Darush Ghanbari, a political analyst and former member of parliament, told Al-Monitor, “Ayatollah Rafsanjani deserves to be the chairman, because he obtained the most votes in the elections. Nonetheless, if Ayatollah Rafsanjani backs Ayatollah Amini, which is possible, his chances will be great. Plus, Ayatollah Amini is well respected among all of the clerics in the assembly.”
http://www.al-monitor.com/pulse/originals/2016/03/iran-assembly-of-experts-internal-election-chairmanship.html +++COMMENT:
according to this article: " it is possible that no one will step forward if Amini decides to run"
the problem here is Amini age.

They key question is whether they will put forward a compromise candidate like Amini (who was also on the Principalist's list) or whether they put forward someone like Rafsanjani that is likely to be opposed by the more hardline coalition.  70% chance they'll put Amini forward and he'll secure the nomination.
30% chance they'll put forward Rafsanjani or another person more firmly in the moderate camp with 62% chance of winning in that scenario (see @mparrault's comment for a good base rate start) That gives us .7*.99 + .3*.62= .879 Plan to adjust as we get more info on Amini and others likelihood of running.

I would be interested in other's comments.  It appears there is an organization that dedicates itself to the Assembly of Experts for Leadership (see attached link). http://en.rcipt.ir/index.aspx?fkeyid=&siteid=4&pageid=433&newsview=286 There seem to be the following three main requirements in the Iran Constitution for selecting candidates: Article 109
Following are the essential qualifications and conditions for the Leader: 
 
1.scholarship, as required for performing the functions of mufti in different fields of  fiqh. 
2.Justice and piety, as required for the leadership of the Islamic Ummah. 
3.right political and social perspicacity, prudence, courage, administrative facilities and adequate capability for leadership. In case of multiplicity of persons fulfilling the above qualifications and conditions, the person possessing the better jurisprudential and political perspicacity will be given preference.  Since the People's Expert list appears to be a new category, it would depend on whether the candidates were proportioned amongst the 4 rather than 3 categories.
Yes.  The stresses with Saudi and the U.S. will not have slackened by then and people will be more conservative.

Adjusting my probability upwards because 000 who uses metanalysis of the most accurate predictors now forecasts 83% and Sjens, who has a Brier score of 0.187 forecast it at 90%. I cannot see a hardliner winning, they have little popular support.
I think it likely, but that doesn't take into account election fixing or fraud.

It may depend on whether Ebrahim Amini decides to put his name forth for chairman. This was the People's Experts list: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/People's_Experts I cannot find the List of Hope for the Assembly of Experts, only for the Consultative Assembly. It looks like they share lists with the "People's Experts", so basically the same list. Ebrahim Amini was on every list for the Assembly of Experts, so hopefully that means he is a shoe-in if he wants the job. He's quite elderly, but maybe that helps. His detractors could see it as a good thing: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Iranian_Assembly_of_Experts_election,_2016#Details
Many cross-currents.  Reformers will probably be added to the Assembly of Experts, but probably not as the Chairman...

"Moderates performed well in the election and Ayatollah Amini has been approached to be a candidate for Chair.  He may decline but that is unlikely.  The election is scheduled for May 24th. "Rafsanjani and the moderates have asked Ayatollah Ebrahim Amini to step forward and seek the assembly's chairmanship.
Amini, 91, is a former Qom Friday prayer leader and is highly respected among all factions
http://www.al-monitor.com/pulse/originals/2016/03/iran-assembly-of-experts-internal-election-chairmanship.html#ixzz46NjNbI5Z

I think that is next to impossible given the current power structure within Iran. Also, the term candidate and elected have far different meanings in this context, I think it can be more accurately be described as "following a loose process to show some formality to the masses regarding the person that is hand picked by the supreme leader as he is moved into the chairman of Iran's assembly of experts role.

H/T @dkc http://www.al-monitor.com/pulse/originals/2016/03/iran-assembly-of-experts-internal-election-chairmanship.html "Rafsanjani and the moderates have asked Ayatollah Ebrahim Amini to step forward and seek the assembly's chairmanship. Amini, 91, is a former Qom Friday prayer leader and is highly respected among all factions. That he appeared on both the Principlists’ and Rafsanjani’s ticket for the February elections serves as an indicator of his stature. Amini has moderate views and is close to Rafsanjani............Nevertheless, it is possible that no one will step forward if Amini decides to run. Such a scenario has played out in the past..... “In the case of Ayatollah Amini’s nomination, moderates and even hard-liners will support him. It is also possible that hard-line candidates will not run for the election when they realize that their rival will be Ayatollah Amini.” Yet, it is not clear whether Amini has accepted Rafsanjani’s reported proposal. Of note, Amini declined Rafsanjani’s previous offer to head the Center for Strategic Research, citing his old age." Reading the above, I would be at 100% if Amini wasn't 91 years old. However, I'll start at 90% while waiting to see if Amini agrees to stand. If he doesn't, then the probability would be closer to 65% (as the List of Hope is said to have won 56 out of 88 seats) unless another widely respected candidate is found from among these two lists.

62% of candidates are on the People's Expert List (which is almost exactly the same as the List of Hope), so a reasonable base rate estimate is 62%.  I'm going to start a bit higher than that, based on the sentiment of the crowd here.
It is probably not quite time for democracy to work its intermittent and unpredictable magic on this body.  Need to keep an eye on it, though.

https://majlismonitor.com/en/2016/03/analysis-2016-iranian-parliamentary-assembly-of-experts-election-results/
"In the assembly elections the largely conservative Combatant Clergy Association performed the best with 68 out of 88 seats or 77.3 percent, followed by the largely hardline conservative Society of Seminary Teachers of Qom with 64 seats or 72.7 percent, the largely centrist-traditional conservative Hope List with 56 seats or 63.6 percent, and finally independents with four seats or 4.6 percent. There is a large overlap  between the assembly lists, with 37 assemblymen even appearing on all three lists" Comment:  List of Hope and People´s Expert List won overwhelmingly in the seat of power-Tehran, and a chairmanship rotation would go in line with past iranian political practice, plus overlap of lists indicates that an accommodation of a candidate that appears in more than one list may be the most probable result.
